Teentaal.bols: Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Tin Tin Ta | Ta Dhin Dhin Dha
Teentaal.description: The most common tala in Hindustani classical music, with 16 beats divided into four equal sections.
variations: Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Tin Tin Na | Na Dhin Dhin Dha
Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Tin Tin Ta | Tete Dhin Dhin Dha
Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Tirkit Tin Ta | Ta Dhin Dhin Dha

Ektaal.bols: Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha | Tu Na | Ka Ta | Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha
Ektaal.description: A 12-beat tala divided into six sections of two beats each, commonly used in slower compositions.
variations: Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha | Tu Na | Ka Ta | Tin Tin | Ta Ta
Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha | Dhi Na | Dhi Na | Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha
Dhin Dhin | Dha Dha | Tu Na | Ka Ta | Dhi Dhi | Na Na

Jhaptaal.bols: Dhin Na | Dhin Dhin Na | Tin Na | Dhin Dhin Na
Jhaptaal.description: A 10-beat tala with an asymmetrical structure, divided into sections of 2, 3, 2, and 3 beats.
variations: Dhin Na | Dhin Dhin Na | Tin Na | Tin Tin Na
Dhin Na | Dhin Dhin Na | Tin Na | Dha Dhin Na
Dhin Na | Dha Dhin Na | Tin Na | Dha Dhin Na

Keherwa.bols: Dha Ge Na Ti | Na Ka Dhi Na
Keherwa.description: An 8-beat tala commonly used in light classical and folk music, divided into two equal sections.
variations: Dha Dhin Na Ti | Na Dhin Dhin Na
Dha Ge Na Ti | Ta Ke Dhi Na
Dha Tirkit Dhin Na | Ta Tirkit Dhin Na

Rupak.bols: Tin Tin Na | Dhin Na | Dhin Na
Rupak.description: A 7-beat tala with an unusual clap pattern that begins with a wave (empty beat) rather than a clap.
variations: Tin Tin Na | Tin Na | Dhin Na
Tin Tin Na | Dhin Na | Tin Na
Ti Ri Na | Dhi Na | Dhi Na

Dadra.bols: Dha Dhin Na | Ta Tin Na
Dadra.description: A 6-beat tala commonly used in semi-classical forms like thumri and dadra, divided into two equal sections.
variations: Dha Dhin Na | Ta Tin Na
Dha Ti Na | Ta Tin Na
Dha Dhin Na | Dha Dhin Na

Deepchandi.bols: Dha Dhin | Na Dha Tin Na | Ta Dhin | Na Dha Dhin Na
Deepchandi.description: A 14-beat tala commonly used in semi-classical forms like thumri, with an asymmetrical structure.
variations: Dha Dhin | Na Dha Tin Na | Ta Dhin | Na Dha Dhin Na
Dha Dhin | Na Dha Tin Na | Dha Dhin | Na Dha Dhin Na
Dha Dhin | Na Dha Tin Na | Ta Dhin | Dha Dha Dhin Na

Chautaal.bols: Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Ta Ta | Dhin Dha
Chautaal.description: A 12-beat tala with a distinctive clap pattern, commonly used in dhrupad and dhamar compositions.
variations: Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Ta Ta | Dhin Dha
Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Tin Tin | Dha Dha
Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Dha Dha | Dhin Ta | Ta Ta | Tin Dha

Dhamar.bols: Ka Dhi Ta Dhi Ta | Ta Ka | Dhi Ta Dhi | Ta Ka Dhi Ta
Dhamar.description: A 14-beat tala specifically used for the dhamar genre, with an asymmetrical structure.
variations: Ka Dhi Ta Dhi Ta | Ta Ka | Dhi Ta Dhi | Ta Ka Dhi Ta
Ka Dhi Ta Dhi Ta | Dha Ka | Dhi Ta Dhi | Ta Ka Dhi Ta
Ka Dhi Ta Dhi Ta | Ta Ka | Dhi Ta Dhi | Dha Ka Dhi Ta

Tilwada.bols: Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Tin Ta | Ta Tin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Dhin Dha
Tilwada.description: A 16-beat tala similar to Teentaal but with a different distribution of bols, used in instrumental music.
variations: Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Tin Ta | Ta Tin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Dhin Dha
Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Tin Ta | Ta Tin Dhin Dha | Dha Tirkit Dhin Dha
Dha Dhin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Tin Ta | Dha Tin Dhin Dha | Dha Dha Dhin Dha
